title: Custom Validation in tenzing
text: validation system tenzing consists three main components: ColumnValidator ‚Äì Ensures required columns exist contributors table. Validator ‚Äì Runs logical checks contents table (e.g., missing values, duplicate names). ValidateOutput ‚Äì Combines column data validation, allowing customized validation pipelines using YAML configuration files. leveraging components, can create validation rules check specific issues data.

title: Custom Validation in tenzing
text: Validation rules written functions tenzing. functions take contributors_table input return list two elements: type: Can ‚Äúsuccess‚Äù, ‚Äúwarning‚Äù, ‚Äúerror‚Äù, indicating result check. message: user-friendly explanation check result.

title: Custom Validation in tenzing
text: Let‚Äôs say want create check ensures every contributor valid ORCID ID.
code: #' Check for valid ORCID IDs #' #' This function checks if the ORCID IDs in the `contributors_table` are formatted correctly. #' #' @param contributors_table A dataframe containing the contributors' information. #' #' @return A list containing: #' \item{type}{Type of validation result: "success", "warning", or "error".} #' \item{message}{An informative message indicating if any ORCID IDs are invalid.} check_orcid <- function(contributors_table) {   if (!"ORCID" %in% colnames(contributors_table)) {     return(list(       type = "warning",       message = "No ORCID column found. ORCID validation skipped."     ))   }      invalid_orcids <- contributors_table %>%     dplyr::filter(!grepl("^\\d{4}-\\d{4}-\\d{4}-\\d{4}$", .data$ORCID) & !is.na(.data$ORCID))      if (nrow(invalid_orcids) > 0) {     return(list(       type = "warning",       message = glue::glue("Invalid ORCID format for the following rows: {paste(invalid_orcids$rowname, collapse = ', ')}")     ))   }      return(list(type = "success", message = "All ORCID IDs are correctly formatted.")) }

title: Custom Validation in tenzing
text: define validation function, need tell tenzing use . done specifying validation YAML configuration file. tenzing includes set predefined validation helpers R/validation_helpers.R. include: - check_missing_order ‚Äì Ensures contributors order publication. - check_duplicate_order ‚Äì Ensures duplicate order numbers unless multiple first authors exist. - check_missing_surname ‚Äì Ensures contributors surname. - check_duplicate_names ‚Äì Ensures duplicate contributor names. - check_affiliation_consistency ‚Äì Ensures one affiliation format used. - Many ‚Ä¶ functions automatically available setting validation tenzing.

title: Custom Validation in tenzing
text: config/columnvalidator_example.yaml:
code: column_config:   rules:     minimal:       operator: "AND"       columns:         - Firstname         - Middle name         - Surname         - Order in publication       severity: "error"     affiliation:       operator: "OR"  # Either legacy OR regex-based affiliation columns must be present       columns:         - Primary affiliation         - Secondary affiliation  # Legacy columns       regex: "^Affiliation [0-9]+$"  # Regex-based columns       severity: "error"  # Make sure it's required for validation to pass     title:       operator: "AND"       columns:         - Corresponding author?         - Email address       severity: "warning"

title: ValidateOutput Class for Contributors Table Validation ‚Äî ValidateOutput
text: ValidateOutput class runs column-based validation (ensuring required columns exist) data-based validation (checking correctness values) contributors table. integrates two validation classes: ColumnValidator: Ensures required columns present. Validator: Runs content-based validation checks contributor data. validation process configured via YAML file. inst/config/ package di contains predefined YAML configuration files six output types.

title: ValidateOutput Class for Contributors Table Validation ‚Äî ValidateOutput
text: ColumnValidator ensures required columns exist running data-based checks. required column missing, validation stops immediately error. Example YAML Configuration (inst/config/title_validation.yaml):
code: column_config:   rules:     minimal:       operator: "AND"       columns:         - Firstname         - Middle name         - Surname         - Order in publication       severity: "error"      affiliation:       operator: "OR"       columns:         - Primary affiliation         - Secondary affiliation       regex: "^Affiliation [0-9]+$"       severity: "error"      title:       operator: "AND"       columns:         - Corresponding author?         - Email address       severity: "warning"

title: ValidateOutput Class for Contributors Table Validation ‚Äî ValidateOutput
text: Validator runs content-based validation checks column validation passes. Example Validation Configuration (inst/config/title_validation.yaml): Dependencies: validation checks run conditions met. Example: check_missing_email runs : "Corresponding author?" exists. check_missing_corresponding passed. "Email address" dataset.
code: validation_config:   validations:     - name: check_missing_order     - name: check_duplicate_order     - name: check_missing_surname     - name: check_missing_firstname     - name: check_duplicate_initials     - name: check_missing_corresponding       dependencies:         - '"Corresponding author?"      - name: check_missing_email       dependencies:         - '"Corresponding author?"          - 'self$results[["check_missing_corresponding"]]$type == "success"'         - '"Email address"      - name: check_duplicate_names     - name: check_affiliation     - name: check_affiliation_consistency

title: ValidateOutput Class for Contributors Table Validation ‚Äî ValidateOutput

title: tenzing 0.2.0
text: New output option added. new option allows users generate funding acknowledgment section manuscript. output possible use initials full names. contributor list output option now possible use initials instead full names. Users can also choose list contributions according CRediT taxonomy names contributors. tenzing now allows users read contributors_table directly Google sheets providing share URL spreadsheet. app allows users review contributors_table within app even pass validation checks. two new columns added contributors_table template: ORCiD iD Funding. name CRediT taxonomy roles contributors_table now fixed well URLs directing role taxonomy‚Äôs documentation. contributors_table template now empty. However, filled example template added package external datafile. See vignette("local_use") load example file. title page output option now allows users add multiple first authors prints additional text listing names shared first authors email address corresponding author. app got new, cleaner look.
